org.jdrupes.internal

Class ComponentNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jdrupes.internal.ComponentNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Component>, Manager
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractComponent, ComponentProxy

    public abstract class ComponentNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements Manager
    ComponentNode is the base class for all nodes in the component tree. ComponentNode is extended by AbstractComponent for the use as base class for component implementations. As an alternative for implementing components with an independent base class, the derived class ComponentProxy can be used.
    Author:
    mnl

    • Constructor Detail

      • ComponentNode

        protected ComponentNode()
        Initialize the ComponentNode. By default it forms a stand-alone tree, i.e. the root is set to the component itself.

    • Method Detail

      • initComponentsHandlers

        protected void initComponentsHandlers()
        Initialize the handler list of this component. May only be called when getComponent() can be relied on to return the correct value.

      • addHandler

        public void addHandler(java.lang.Object eventKey,
              java.lang.Object channelKey,
              java.lang.String method)
        Description copied from interface: Manager
        Add a handler for a specific event and channel. The method with the given name must have a single argument of type Event (or a derived type as appropriate for the event type to be handled).
        Specified by:
        addHandler in interface Manager
        Parameters:
        eventKey - the event key that should be used for matching this handler with an event. This is equivalent to an events/namedEvents parameter used with a single value in the handler annotation, but here all kinds of Objects are allowed as key values.
        channelKey - the channel key that should be used for matching this handler with a channel. This is equivalent to a channels/namedChannels parameter used with a single value in the handler annotation, but here all kinds of Objects are allowed as key values. If the actual object provided is a Channel, its match key is used for matching.
        method - the name of the method that implements the handler

      • fire

      • fire

        public void fire(Event event)
        Description copied from interface: Manager
        Fire the given event on the component's channel. This is a shortcut for fire(event, getChannel()).
        Specified by:
        fire in interface Manager
        Parameters:
        event -
        See Also:
